verses.text: Now after \w this|strong="H0310"\w* it came to pass, that \w David|strong="H1732"\w* \w smote|strong="H5221"\w* the \w Philistines|strong="H6430"\w*, and \w subdued|strong="H3665"\w* them, and \w took|strong="H3947"\w* \w Gath|strong="H1661"\w* and her \w towns|strong="H1323"\w* out of the \w hand|strong="H3027"\w* of the \w Philistines|strong="H6430"\w*.

And he \w smote|strong="H5221"\w* \w Moab|strong="H4124"\w*; and the \w Moabites|strong="H4124"\w* became \w David’s|strong="H1732"\w* \w servants|strong="H5650"\w*, \add and\add* \w brought|strong="H5375"\w* \w gifts|strong="H4503"\w*.

¶ And \w David|strong="H1732"\w* \w smote|strong="H5221"\w* \w Hadarezer|strong="H1928"\w* \w king|strong="H4428"\w* of \w Zobah|strong="H6678"\w* unto \w Hamath|strong="H2574"\w*, as he \w went|strong="H3212"\w* to \w stablish|strong="H5324"\w* his \w dominion|strong="H3027"\w* by the \w river|strong="H5104"\w* \w Euphrates|strong="H6578"\w*.\f + \fr 18.3 \ft Hadarezer: or, Hadadezer\f*

And \w David|strong="H1732"\w* \w took|strong="H3920"\w* from him a \w thousand|strong="H0505"\w* \w chariots|strong="H7393"\w*, and \w seven|strong="H7651"\w* \w thousand|strong="H0505"\w* \w horsemen|strong="H6571"\w*, and \w twenty|strong="H6242"\w* \w thousand|strong="H0505"\w* \w footmen|strong="H0376"\w*: \w David|strong="H1732"\w* also \w houghed|strong="H6131"\w* all the \w chariot|strong="H7393"\w* \add horses\add*, but \w reserved|strong="H3498"\w* of them an \w hundred|strong="H3967"\w* \w chariots|strong="H7393"\w*.\f + \fr 18.4 \ft seven…: or, seven hundred\f*

And when the \w Syrians|strong="H0758"\w* of \w Damascus|strong="H1834"\w* \w came|strong="H0935"\w* to \w help|strong="H5826"\w* \w Hadarezer|strong="H1928"\w* \w king|strong="H4428"\w* of \w Zobah|strong="H6678"\w*, \w David|strong="H1732"\w* \w slew|strong="H5221"\w* of the \w Syrians|strong="H0758"\w* \w two|strong="H8147"\w* and \w twenty|strong="H6242"\w* \w thousand|strong="H0505"\w* \w men|strong="H0376"\w*.\f + \fr 18.5 \ft Damascus: Heb. Darmesek\f*

Then \w David|strong="H1732"\w* \w put|strong="H7760"\w* \add garrisons\add* in \w Syria-damascus|strong="H0758"\w*; and the \w Syrians|strong="H0758"\w* became \w David’s|strong="H1732"\w* \w servants|strong="H5650"\w*, \add and\add* \w brought|strong="H5375"\w* \w gifts|strong="H4503"\w*. Thus the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* \w preserved|strong="H3467"\w* \w David|strong="H1732"\w* whithersoever he \w went|strong="H1980"\w*.

And \w David|strong="H1732"\w* \w took|strong="H3947"\w* the \w shields|strong="H7982"\w* of \w gold|strong="H2091"\w* that were on the \w servants|strong="H5650"\w* of \w Hadarezer|strong="H1928"\w*, and \w brought|strong="H0935"\w* them to \w Jerusalem|strong="H3389"\w*.

Likewise from \w Tibhath|strong="H2880"\w*, and from \w Chun|strong="H3560"\w*, \w cities|strong="H5892"\w* of \w Hadarezer|strong="H1928"\w*, \w brought|strong="H3947"\w* \w David|strong="H1732"\w* \w very|strong="H3966"\w* \w much|strong="H7227"\w* \w brass|strong="H5178"\w*, wherewith \w Solomon|strong="H8010"\w* \w made|strong="H6213"\w* the \w brasen|strong="H5178"\w* \w sea|strong="H3220"\w*, and the \w pillars|strong="H5982"\w*, and the \w vessels|strong="H3627"\w* of \w brass|strong="H5178"\w*.\f + \fr 18.8 \ft Tibhath…: called in the book of Samuel Betah, and Berothai\f*

¶ Now when \w Tou|strong="H8583"\w* \w king|strong="H4428"\w* of \w Hamath|strong="H2574"\w* \w heard|strong="H8085"\w* how \w David|strong="H1732"\w* had \w smitten|strong="H5221"\w* all the \w host|strong="H2428"\w* of \w Hadarezer|strong="H1928"\w* \w king|strong="H4428"\w* of \w Zobah|strong="H6678"\w*;\f + \fr 18.9 \ft Tou: also called, Toi\f*

He \w sent|strong="H7971"\w* \w Hadoram|strong="H1913"\w* his \w son|strong="H1121"\w* to \w king|strong="H4428"\w* \w David|strong="H1732"\w*, to \w enquire|strong="H7592"\w* of his \w welfare|strong="H7965"\w*, and to \w congratulate|strong="H1288"\w* him, because he had \w fought|strong="H3898"\w* against \w Hadarezer|strong="H1928"\w*, and \w smitten|strong="H5221"\w* him; (for \w Hadarezer|strong="H1928"\w* had \w war|strong="H0376"\w* with \w Tou|strong="H8583"\w*;) and \add with him\add* all manner of \w vessels|strong="H3627"\w* of \w gold|strong="H2091"\w* and \w silver|strong="H3701"\w* and \w brass|strong="H5178"\w*.\f + \fr 18.10 \ft Hadoram: also called, Joram\f*\f + \fr 18.10 \ft to enquire…: or, to salute\f*\f + \fr 18.10 \ft to congratulate: Heb. to bless\f*\f + \fr 18.10 \ft had war: Heb. was the man of wars\f*

¶ Them also \w king|strong="H4428"\w* \w David|strong="H1732"\w* \w dedicated|strong="H6942"\w* unto the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, with the \w silver|strong="H3701"\w* and the \w gold|strong="H2091"\w* that he \w brought|strong="H5375"\w* from all \add these\add* \w nations|strong="H1471"\w*; from \w Edom|strong="H0123"\w*, and from \w Moab|strong="H4124"\w*, and from the \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Ammon|strong="H5983"\w*, and from the \w Philistines|strong="H6430"\w*, and from \w Amalek|strong="H6002"\w*.

Moreover \w Abishai|strong="H0052"\w* the \w son|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Zeruiah|strong="H6870"\w* \w slew|strong="H5221"\w* of the \w Edomites|strong="H0123"\w* in the \w valley|strong="H1516"\w* of \w salt|strong="H4417"\w* \w eighteen|strong="H8083"\w* \w thousand|strong="H0505"\w*.\f + \fr 18.12 \ft Abishai: Heb. Abshai\f*

¶ And he \w put|strong="H7760"\w* \w garrisons|strong="H5333"\w* in \w Edom|strong="H0123"\w*; and all the \w Edomites|strong="H0123"\w* became \w David’s|strong="H1732"\w* \w servants|strong="H5650"\w*. Thus the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* \w preserved|strong="H3467"\w* \w David|strong="H1732"\w* whithersoever he \w went|strong="H1980"\w*.

¶ So \w David|strong="H1732"\w* \w reigned|strong="H4427"\w* over all \w Israel|strong="H3478"\w*, and \w executed|strong="H6213"\w* \w judgment|strong="H4941"\w* and \w justice|strong="H6666"\w* among all his \w people|strong="H5971"\w*.

And \w Joab|strong="H3097"\w* the \w son|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Zeruiah|strong="H6870"\w* \add was\add* over the \w host|strong="H6635"\w*; and \w Jehoshaphat|strong="H3092"\w* the \w son|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Ahilud|strong="H0286"\w*, \w recorder|strong="H2142"\w*.\f + \fr 18.15 \ft recorder: or, remembrancer\f*

And \w Zadok|strong="H6659"\w* the \w son|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Ahitub|strong="H0285"\w*, and \w Abimelech|strong="H0040"\w* the \w son|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Abiathar|strong="H0054"\w*, \add were\add* the \w priests|strong="H3548"\w*; and \w Shavsha|strong="H7798"\w* was \w scribe|strong="H5608"\w*;\f + \fr 18.16 \ft Abimelech: also called, Ahimelech\f*\f + \fr 18.16 \ft Shavsha: also called Seraiah or Shisha\f*

And \w Benaiah|strong="H1141"\w* the \w son|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Jehoiada|strong="H3077"\w* \add was\add* over the \w Cherethites|strong="H3774"\w* and the \w Pelethites|strong="H6432"\w*; and the \w sons|strong="H1121"\w* of \w David|strong="H1732"\w* \add were\add* \w chief|strong="H7223"\w* \w about|strong="H3027"\w* the \w king|strong="H4428"\w*.\f + \fr 18.17 \ft about…: Heb. at the hand of the king\f*
